problems.title: Count Inversions using Merge Sort
problems.description:
Problem Statement

You are given an array of N integers.
An inversion is a pair (i, j) where i < j but arr[i] > arr[j].
Count the total number of inversions using the Divide and Conquer approach (modified Merge Sort).

Example: In array [2, 4, 1, 3, 5], inversions are (2,1), (4,1), (4,3) = 3 inversions.
problems.examples:
Sample Input
5
2 4 1 3 5

Sample Output
3

Explanation:
Inversions: (2,1), (4,1), (4,3). Total = 3.
